name: Turkey Carcass Soup
author: Please Close My Account
summary: A great way to not waste a single bite of turkey. This is a delicious soup and one of my favorites. If you want to freeze some, leave out the potatoes.
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, chopped
¼ teaspoon freshly cracked black pepper
directions: Place the turkey carcass into a large soup pot or stock pot and pour in the water; bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, and cook the turkey frame until the remaining meat falls off the bones, about 1 hour
Remove the turkey carcass and remove and chop any remaining turkey meat
Strain the broth through a fine mesh strainer into a clean soup pot

Add the chopped turkey to the strained broth; bring the to a boil, reduce heat, and stir in the potatoes, carrots, celery, onion, cabbage, tomatoes, barley, Worcestershire sauce, salt, parsley, basil, bay leaf, black pepper, paprika, poultry seasoning, and thyme
Simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 1 more hour
